required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on April 10, 2017
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Assessment of Polyethylene Wear, Migration and Clinical Outcome in Total Hip Replacement
clinical_study.official_title: Assessment of Polyethylene Wear, Migration and Clinical Outcome in Total Hip Replacement - A Prospective Randomized Control Trial

brief_summary.textblock:
The aim of this study is to investigate the wear of two different polyethylene liners (E-Poly and ArcomXL, Biomet inc.) of primary total hip arthroplasty. This study is divided into one main study and three sub-studies.
- The main study investigates the wear of the liner using radiostereometric analysis (RSA) with five years follow-up. A two year follow-up analysis will be reported.
- Other studies i) investigate the cup migration in respect to the pelvis between two different femoral head sizes (32- and 36-mm), ii) clinical outcome score (Harris Hip Score, SF-36, UCLA, EQ5D) will also be evaluated.
An explorative study will be conducted investigating the possibility of using a bi-plane technique as RSA to detect the rigid body segment of the hip with a reduction of roentgen dose.

study_design_info.masking: Double Blind (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Change in liner wear from baseline to 5 year follow up
primary_outcome.description: Comparing polyethylene wear up to 5 years postoperatively between the second generation vitamin E impregnate HXLPE liner (E-poly) with the first generation HXLPE liner (ArComXL)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in cup migration form baseline to 5 year followup
secondary_outcome.description: Comparing migration of the orthopedic cup in relation to the pelvis in patients with different femoral head sizes (32- vs. 36-mm)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in clinical outcome score from baseline to 5 year follow-up
secondary_outcome.description: Comparing clinical outcome sore between patient with two different femoral head sizes (32- vs. 36-mm). Harris Hip Score, SF-36, EQ5D and UCLA

other_outcome.measure: biplane setup for measuring hip prosthesis
other_outcome.description: Measuring accuracy and precision of the hip prostheses in a biplane setup

arm_group.description: E-Poly™ polyethylene liner in a titanium total hip arthroplasty with 32- and 36-mm femoral head.
ArcomXL® polyethylene liner in a titanium total hip arthroplasty with 32- and 36-mm femoral head.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Primary unilateral uncemented
- Primary idiopathic arthritis,
- 40 to70 years of age,
- Cup-size of 54mm and above
Exclusion Criteria:
- Anteversion where non-standard stem can be used,
- Dysplasia (Center-edge angle of Wiberg < 20 degree),
- Malignant condition, Prior radiotherapy, Physical or psychological condition (stated in the department's standard operation procedure),
- Complications during surgery (requiring screws in shell or femoral cerclage)

overall_official.last_name: Dennis B Nielsen, PhD. Student, Eng.
